Description: The Flight into Egypt: altered from Hercules Seghers; the Virgin riding a donkey led by Joseph on a hillside in the right foreground, a forest behind them and a landscape with a canal and hamlet in the central background; fourth state with further branches and foliage added to the trees behind and to the left of the Holy Family, before highlights have been burnished on the figures and the ground in front of the Holy Family, before cross-hatching has been added around the Virgin, on her back, next to the donkey's head and on Joseph's cloak, before dirty marks in the sky. c. 1652 Etching, burin and drypoint with surface tone on Japan paper
Curator's comments: For an impression of second state and comment see 1848,0911.31.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (271.IV) (Rembrandt)
Hind 1923 / A Catalogue of Rembrandt's Etchings; chronologically arranged and completely illustrated (266.IV)
White & Boon 1969 / Rembrandt's Etchings: An Illustrated Critical Catalogue (56.IV)
Hinterding et al. 2000 / Rembrandt the Printmaker (71)
Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1) (Segers)
Haverkamp Begemann 1973 / Hercules Segers: The complete etchings (1)
Exhibition history: 2011 March-June, Tokyo, NM Western Art, Rembrandt: Dark Tonalities 2011 June-Sep, Nagoya City Art Museum, Rembrandt: Dark Tonalities
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Heneage Finch, 5th Earl of Aylesford (L.58)
